## [05:36] Private School Funding

**PREMIER DANIELLE SMITH:** Well, I look at it differently. We've got about 100,000 students who go to either a homeschooling or a charter school or an independent school. And if you tried to take all of those hundred thousand students and put them into our existing public school system, it would collapse the system. There just isn't space for them. So I would say we look at that. We're kind of grateful to parents that they're willing to pay a portion of the cost of their kids education. It saves taxpayer money. For every child who is in a charter school, they're about equivalent. They're not allowed to charge tuition. But for every child who's in an independent school, US at least $5,000 per child and for every child who's homeschooled, they only get $850. That saves us almost $12,000 per child. So that's the way people should look at it is that these are tax paying parents that are not only willing to pay their fair share of taxes to support everybody else's education, but they're also willing to take on the cost of their own kids education. And if all of those kids were in the public system being paid at the same level that every other child in the public system is being paid at, that would cost taxpayers an additional $500 million. So it a little bit differently. I think that the, the fact that we do have parents that want choice and are willing to support choice with their own dollars, I think that we should be grateful to them.
